page.title: 07HOUSING IN TADLEY
page.content: In the part of Tadley covered by this survey some of the houses are owned by the Ministry of Defence and rented to staff of the AWRE; most of them were built in the 1950s. There are a number of new estates in Tadley and Baughurst to house both AWRE workers and those working in the "hi-tech" industries of the district. Both old and new estates are well planned with large gardens and plenty of woodland and open space. Prices in 1985 range from Â£35,000+ for a two bedroom town house to over Â£70,000 for a four bedroom detached house. In addition there are old peoples flats, some council houses and caravans. Young people are able to buy houses in Tadley and most find it a pleasant mixture of town and country, however, many would like tighter planning controls to halt further development.
